thread.title: Everton to make a £40million double swoop for England starlets Michael Keane and Jordan Pickford
thread.title_full: Everton to make a £40million double swoop for England starlets Michael Keane and Jordan Pickford

author: fnathan
title: Everton to make a £40million double swoop for England starlets Michael Keane and Jordan Pickford
text:
koe's pic 'n mic Everton to make a £40million double swoop for England starlets Michael Keane and Jordan Pickford 
Boss Ronald Koeman is ahead in the race for two of our brightest talents in Burnley defender Keane and Sunderland keeper Pickford Exclusive By Mike McGrath and Ken Lawrence 25th March 2017, 10:30 pm Updated: 26th March 2017, 6:08 am Comments EVERTON will make a £40million double swoop for England starlets Michael Keane and Jordan Pickford. 
Boss Ronald Koeman is ahead of a pack of big hitters in the race for two of our brightest talents. Reuters 3 Michael Keane has impressed for Burnley this season in his first Premier League campaign 
Keep up to date with ALL the Premier League news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Keane, who should win his second cap against Lithuania today, knows he will be quitting Burnley this summer in a £25m move . 
And the 24-year-old favours a switch to Everton as he will be a first-team regular there, partnering Ashley Williams in the heart of defence. Reuters 3 While Jordan Pickford is emerging as one of the best young keepers in the country 
Mersey rivals Liverpool want Keane and the Stockport-born star is even being eyed by former club Manchester United. most read in football Not good enough Antonio Conte has sensationally rejected the chance to sign Neymar in a £155m deal from Barcelona leg-break horror Seamus Coleman set for surgery on potential career-threatening injury after his leg is snapped in half by Neil Taylor's wild tackle TV TIMES What TV channel is England vs Lithuania on, what time is kick-off and what is the latest team news? LIONHEART Brave Bradley Lowery gets the biggest cheer at Wembley as he leads out the England team with goal hero and best mate Jermain Defoe Seeing Red Keith Gillespie launches viscous elbow into face of opponent during Man United charity match 'I don't even like football' Neil Taylor is hammered on Twitter after breaking Seamus Coleman’s leg… but it’s an ex-councillor not the Wales defender taking the brunt of the abuse Getty Images 3 Keane made his England debut this week against Germany 
The United fan says he is “flattered” by the growing interest in him but guaranteed game time is his No 1 priority. 
Sunderland keeper Pickford, 23, has attracted interest from Premier League heavyweights Manchester City, Tottenham and Arsenal. Sunderland goalkeeper Jordan Pickford produces another world class save 
But Goodison gaffer Koeman has made the first serious move in the race for £15m-rated England Under-21 star. 
The Black Cats are currently seven points adrift of safety at the bottom of the Premier League. And they are likely to cash in on youth product Pickford if they go down at the end of the season.
